body.p: The Changes view displays all the files that have been changed in the workspace. It contains two tabs: Made by you and History.

section.title: Made by You Tab
section.p: The Made by you tab displays all the changes you have made in your workspace. It provides the following main options:

ul.li:
Commit: Allows you to commit your changes to the project. You can select which files to include in the commit using check-boxes next to each file. Files not selected will remain in your workspace.
When you are ready, click the Commit button, provide a commit message, and commit your changes.

New Review Task: Allows you to create a review task that contains all your current changes so others can review them before integration.
To create a review task, click the New Review Task button. You can set a title, due date, and select a context publication. All changed files are included in the review task.If you exclude any files from the commit, the New Review Task button is disabled, as creating a review task from a selection of files is not currently supported.
You can then share the task with Reviewers.
Click on a file to see a comparison (diff) of your workspace version (left) and the repository version (right).

Use the contextual menu (three vertical dots) next to a file for actions such as:
Open file: Opens the latest editable workspace version.
Discard changes: Discards your changes to the file.
Deselect all files: Deselects all selected files.
Discard changes from all files: Discards all your changes.

section.title: History Tab
section.p: The History tab shows all repository commits up to the latest one in your workspace. Features include:

ul.li: Viewing the commit graph, which displays the history of branches and merges.
Hovering over a commit to see details such as the committer's name, date, and commit message.
Clicking on a commit to display the files included in that commit at the bottom of the pane.
